summary: Henry F. Graff was a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). The documents mention him in the context of the ARRB's work to declassify and release records related to the JFK assassination. He is mentioned in documents that discuss the ARRB's requests for information from the CIA, the declassification of military records related to Cuba, and concerns about the pace of declassification. He is also included in a document providing biographical information for the members of the ARRB.
significance: As a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB), Henry F. Graff played a role in the declassification and release of government records related to the JFK assassination. His involvement was part of the broader effort to provide transparency and historical context to the events surrounding the assassination.
